title: BC-AP News Coverage Advisory, 10:25
snippet:
Here are the AP's latest coverage plans, top stories and promotable content. All times EDT. For up-to-the minute information on AP's coverage, visit Coverage Plan at https://newsroom.ap.org .

---------------------
body:
HIGHLIGHTING

---------------------

AFGHANISTAN-ISLAMIC STATE (sent)

CONGRESS-RUSSIA PROBE (sent, developing)

UNITED STATES-MEXICO (sent, developing)

OJ SIMPSON-25 YEARS (sent)

DAVID ORTIZ SHOT (sent, developing)

NAVAL WAR COLLEGE (sent, developing)

--------------------------------------

WHAT WE'RE TALKING ABOUT

--------------------------------------

INDIA-RAPE CONVICTIONS _ Indian court jails 3 for life in rape case in Kashmir. SENT: 370 words, photos.bri

BRITAIN-PRINCE PHILIP _ Prince Philip marks 98th birthday in private. SENT: 130 words, photo.

BRITAIN-STARBUCKS-DISPOSABLE CUPS _ Starbucks launches reusable cups trial at UK airport. SENT: 150 words, photo.

CANADA PLASTICS BAN _ Canada to ban single-use plastics. SENT: 370 words, photo.

BUSHWHICK BILL _ Rapper Bushwick Bill of the Geto Boys dies at 52. SENT: 440 words, photo.

BURGER KING-TABLE TOP _ Burger King retraining workers at Florida franchise after employee is caught on video cleaning table with floor mop. SENT: 100 words.

------------------------------

WASHINGTON/POLITICS

------------------------------

CONGRESS-RUSSIA PROBE _ Top Democratic leaders may be in no rush to launch an impeachment inquiry, but the party is launching a series of hearings this week on special counsel Robert Mueller’s report. By Mary Clare Jalonick. SENT: 850 words, photos. UPCOMING: Developing from 2 p.m. hearing.

UNITED STATES-MEXICO _ With his threatened Mexican tariffs now on the backburner, President Donald Trump looks to claim victory even as some of his Democratic challengers for the White House criticize him for a deal that mostly ramps up existing efforts. By Jill Colvin. SENT: 940 words, photos. UPCOMING: Developing.

WORKING LONGER-COUNTIES _ Seniors in major metropolitan areas, especially in the Northeast and around Washington, D.C., are more likely to continue working past age 65 than those in other areas around the country, according to an analysis of Census data by The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research. SENT: 1,040 words, photos.

ELECTION 2020-HOUSE DEMOCRATS _Activists hoping to defeat House Democrats in next year's primary elections with more diverse and progressive candidates say the high-profile success they had last year with Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's victory creates a new concern. They worry that excitement among liberals will create a glut of challengers in some races that will split the anti-incumbent vote. SENT: 1,000 words, photos.

ELECTION 2020-WARREN-SANDERS _Bernie Sanders is now trying to fend off a challenge from Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, whose carefully orchestrated campaign is appealing to progressive Democrats who were once avid Sanders supporters. And Warren is offering a fresh face and lots of detailed plans for what she would do as president. SENT: 1,030 words, photos.

FACT CHECK-WEEK _President Donald Trump is bragging about a new deal with Mexico that provides for “large” sales of U.S. farm goods, but it doesn’t appear to exist. It was one of many claims in the past week that deserved scrutiny. By Cal Woodward. SENT: 2,900 words, photos.

-------------

NATIONAL

-------------

NAVAL WAR COLLEGE _ The Navy says the president of the U.S. Naval War College was reassigned pending the outcome of an inspector general investigation. The administrative reassignment of Rear Adm. Jeffrey Harley comes days after The AP reported on the investigation amid allegations that he spent excessively, abused his hiring authority and otherwise behaved inappropriately, including keeping a margarita machine in his office. SENT: 330 words, photos.

OJ SIMPSON-25 YEARS _After 25 years living under the shadow of one of the nation's most notorious murder cases, O.J. Simpson says his life has entered a phase he calls the "no negative zone." In a telephone interview, the 71-year-old Simpson told AP he is healthy and happy living in Las Vegas. And neither he nor his children want to look back by talking about June 12, 1994, when his ex-wife Nicole Brown Simpson and her friend Ronald Goldman were stabbed to death and Simpson was transformed from Hall of Fame football hero to murder suspect. By Linda Deutsch. SENT: 930 words, photos. WITH OJ SIMPSON-25 YEARS-VICTIM’S SISTER _ Kim Goldman turned the agony of her brother Ron’s murder into a career helping troubled teens and aiding crime victims’ rights groups. By John Rogers. SENT: 870 words, photos. WITH OJ SIMPSON-25 YEARS-WHERE ARE THEY NOW (sent)

DIGITAL DIVIDE-HOMEWORK GAP _ Nearly 3 million students in the U.S. struggle to keep up with their studies because they don't have home internet access. In classrooms, laptops and internet connections are nearly universal. But at home the cost of internet service and gaps in its availability create obstacles in urban and rural communities alike. SENT: 1,090 words, photos.

BLACK UNION TROOPS-HISTORIC FLAG _ A hand-painted flag that was carried into battle by a black Union regiment during the Civil War is going up for auction in Pennsylvania. Morphy Auctions in Denver, about 60 miles west of Philadelphia, will sell off the piece of history on June 13. By Kristen De Groot. SENT: 820 words, photos.

---------------------

INTERNATIONAL

---------------------

AFGHANISTAN-ISLAMIC STATE _ The Islamic State group has lost its caliphate in Syria and Iraq, but in the forbidding mountains of northeastern Afghanistan the group is expanding its footprint, recruiting new fighters and plotting attacks on the United States and other Western countries, according to U.S. and Afghan security officials. By Kathy Gannon. SENT: 1,590 words, photos. This is the Tuesday Spotlight. DAVID ORTIZ SHOT _ Former Boston Red Sox slugger David Ortiz was hospitalized following surgery for a gunshot wound after being ambushed by a man in a bar in his native Dominican, authorities say. SENT: 460 words, photos.

HONG KONG-EXTRADITION LAW _ Hong Kong's leader signaled that her government will push ahead with controversial amendments to extradition laws despite a massive protest against them that underscored fears about mainland China's broadening footprint in the semi-autonomous territory. SENT: 690 words, photos.

MALI-MASSACRE _ Unknown assailants killed at least 95 people in an ethnic Dogon village overnight in the latest massacre to destabilize central Mali, a government official says. SENT: 360 words.

PAKISTAN-POLITICS _ Pakistan's anti-graft body arrested former President Asif Ali Zardari, widower of assassinated ex-Premier Benazir Bhutto, in a multi-million dollar money laundering case that has shaken the country. SENT: 430 words, photos.

PERSIAN GULF TENSIONS _Iran's foreign minister warned the U.S. on Monday that it "cannot expect to stay safe" after launching what he described as an economic war against Tehran, taking a hard-line stance amid a visit by Germany's top diplomat seeking to defuse tensions. SENT: 920 words, photos.

SUDAN _ Sudan's ruling military blamed the country's protest movement for an escalation as the second day of the opposition's general strike kicked in. The protesters latest bid to pressure the army to hand over power to civilian rule. SENT: 730 words, photos.

BRITAIN-CONSERVATIVES _ Nominations close in the Brexit-dominated race to become Britain's next prime minister, a contest that will be decided by lawmakers and members of the governing Conservative Party. SENT: 560 words, photos. With BRITAIN-CONSERVATIVES-CONTENDERS, BRITAIN-CONSERVATIVES-GLANCE (both sent)

------------

BUSINESS

------------

SALESFORCE-TABLEAU _ Customer-management software developer Salesforce is buying Tableau Software in an all-stock deal valued at $15.7 billion. SENT: 240 words, photo.

----------------------

ENTERTAINMENT

----------------------

TONY AWARDS_ Actress Ali Stroker's breakthrough win as the first actor in a wheelchair to win a Tony topped an evening of feel-good moments as Broadway honored its own. "Hadestown" was the big winner, grabbing eight awards including best musical. SENT: 1,110 words, photos, video. WITH TONY AWARDS- LIST; TONY AWARDS- ALI STROKER (both sent.)

---------

SPORTS

---------

DAVID ORTIZ SHOT _ Former Boston Red Sox slugger David Ortiz was hospitalized following surgery for a gunshot wound after being ambushed by a man in a bar in his native Dominican, authorities say. SENT: 460 words, photos.

------------------------

HOW TO REACH US

------------------------

At the Nerve Center, Dave Clark can be reached at 800-845-8450 (ext. 1600). For photos, (ext. 1900). For graphics and interactives, ext. 7636. Expanded AP content can be obtained from http://newsroom.ap.org  . For access to AP Newsroom and other technical issues, contact apcustomersupport(at)ap.org or call 877-836-9477.
